column2: title=Fifty New Poems for Children: An Anthology Selected from Books Recently Published by Basil Blackwell
image=[[File:Fifty New Poems for Children 1st Edition 1922 HB.jpg

column1: '''''Fifty New Poems for Children: An Anthology Selected from Books Recently Published by Basil Blackwell''''' is a book which includes [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s poem "[[Goblin Feet]]" (erroneously attributed to "J.R.R. [[Tolkein]]"), which had previously been published in ''[[Oxford Poetry
column2: Oxford Poetry 1915]]''. It also contains the poem "Romance" by E. F. A. Geachh, which [[Douglas A. Anderson]] has suggested could have inspired "[[The Road Goes Ever On (song)
column3: The Road Goes Ever On]]" in ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.<ref name="AH">{{HM

column1: Although the book does not give a publication date, 1922 has been assumed.<ref name="AH"/> However, [[Pieter Collier]] has dated it as [[1924]].<ref>{{webcite
column4: articlename=#000454 - Fifty New Poems for Children
column6: accessed=31-December-2012}}</ref>. It contains pieces published in 1922 and a copy with a January 1923 dated inscription has been seen. The British Library catalogues also list it as 1922, and the book was advertised in the ''Asiatic Review'' (April 1922).{{fact}}

column1: It was reprinted in [[1924]] and [[1929]], and American editions have been seen published by Bretanoâ€™s (undated) and Appleton & Co. (1924).{{fact}}
*[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/dmiller/000454.htm Fifty New Poems for Children] at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/ Tolkien Library]
